text: Remove the comments: While comments are useful in providing context to the code, they make the code more verbose and difficult to read.
Replace the print statements with logging: Instead of using print statements, use the logging module to record information. This will make it easier to find information in the logs if needed.

Extract the function calls: Instead of calling functions directly in the code, extract the function calls into separate helper functions. This will make the code more modular and easier to understand.
Remove unnecessary imports: Remove any imports that are not being used in the code. This will make the code more concise and easier to read.
Refactor the code to remove duplicated logic: If there are sections of code that are duplicated, refactor the code to remove the duplicated logic.
Simplify the functions: If any of the functions in the code are complex, simplify them by breaking them down into smaller functions or by removing any unnecessary logic.
Use proper data types: Use the appropriate data types to represent the data in the code, which will simplify the logic and reduce the risk of bugs.
Use meaningful variable names: Use descriptive variable names that clearly indicate the purpose of the variable. This will make the code easier to read and understand.
Add comments: Add comments to explain the purpose of the code and any complex logic. This will make it easier for other developers to understand the code.
Format the code: Format the code to make it easier to read. This includes adding whitespace, indenting code blocks, and using consistent naming conventions.
Organize the code: Organize the code into logical sections and group related functions together. This will make it easier to find and understand the code.
